meanings.definition: The action of whipping or lashing with a sudden, sharp movement.
meanings.sent1: The whiplashing of the branches in the storm was frightening.
meanings.sent2: The whiplashing of the rope startled the onlookers.
meanings.sent3: The whiplashing of the towel as he tried to dry the dog made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The whiplashing of the waves against the shore was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The whiplashing of the flag in the wind caught everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: A sudden, forceful movement resembling the action of a whip.
meanings.sent1: The whiplashing of the car as it turned the corner made me dizzy.
meanings.sent2: The whiplashing of the dancer's skirt added drama to the performance.
meanings.sent3: The whiplashing of the cat's tail showed its annoyance.
meanings.sent4: The whiplashing of the branches in the wind created a wild dance.
meanings.sent5: The whiplashing of the horse's tail swatted away the flies.
